meanings.definition: A select group that is superior in terms of ability or qualities.
meanings.sent1: The elites in the science club always win the competitions.
meanings.sent2: The elites in the art world are known for their exceptional talent.
meanings.sent3: The elites in the baking class never burn their cookies.
meanings.sent4: She stood out like one of the elites in a sea of mediocrity.
meanings.sent5: The elites of the forest, the wise old owls, gathered to discuss the upcoming winter.

meanings.definition: A group of people who hold a dominant position in a society or organization.
meanings.sent1: The elites of the school council make important decisions.
meanings.sent2: The political elites often influence government policies.
meanings.sent3: The elites of the chess club strategized their way to victory.
meanings.sent4: In the world of fashion, she was considered one of the elites.
meanings.sent5: The elites of the playground, the older kids, ruled over the swings and slides.
